org.turbogwt.core.future.shared.impl

Class AbstractDeferred<D,F,P,C extends Context>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.turbogwt.core.future.shared.impl.AbstractPromise<D,F,P,C>
      • org.turbogwt.core.future.shared.impl.AbstractDeferred<D,F,P,C>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - Type of DoneCallback
    F - Type of FailCallback
    P - Type of ProgressCallback
    C - Type of Context
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Deferred<D,F,P,C>, Promise<D,F,P,C>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeferredObject

    public abstract class AbstractDeferred<D,F,P,C extends Context>
extends AbstractPromise<D,F,P,C>
implements Deferred<D,F,P,C>
    An implementation of Deferred interface. 
     
 final Deferred deferredObject = new AbstractDeferred

 Promise promise = deferredObject.promise();
 promise
   .done(new DoneCallback() { ... })
   .fail(new FailCallback() { ... })
   .progress(new ProgressCallback() { ... });

 Runnable runnable = new Runnable() {
   public void run() {
     int sum = 0;
     for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
       // something that takes time
       sum += i;
       deferredObject.notify(i);
     }
     deferredObject.resolve(sum);
   }
 }
 // submit the task to run
    Author:
    Ray Tsang
    See Also:
    DoneCallback, FailCallback

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Deferred<D,F,P,C> notify(P progress)
      This should be called when a task is still executing and progress had been made, E.g., during a file download, notify the download progress.
      Promise<D,F,P,C> promise()
      Return an Promise instance (i.e., an observer).
      Deferred<D,F,P,C> reject(F reject)
      This should be called when a task has completed unsuccessfully, i.e., a failure may have occurred.
      Deferred<D,F,P,C> resolve(D resolve)
      This should be called when a task has completed successfully.

      • resolve

        public Deferred<D,F,P,C> resolve(D resolve)
        Description copied from interface: Deferred
        This should be called when a task has completed successfully. 
         
 Deferred deferredObject = new AbstractDeferred();
 Promise promise = deferredObject.promise();
 promise.done(new DoneCallback() {
   public void onDone(Object result) {
       // Done!
   }
 });

 // another thread using the same deferredObject
 deferredObject.resolve("OK");
        Specified by:
        resolve in interface Deferred<D,F,P,C extends Context>

      • notify

        public Deferred<D,F,P,C> notify(P progress)
        Description copied from interface: Deferred
        This should be called when a task is still executing and progress had been made, E.g., during a file download, notify the download progress. 
         
 Deferred deferredObject = new AbstractDeferred();
 Promise promise = deferredObject.promise();
 promise.progress(new ProgressCallback() {
   public void onProgress(Object progress) {
       // Failed :(
   }
 });

 // another thread using the same deferredObject
 deferredObject.reject("100%");
        Specified by:

      • reject

        public Deferred<D,F,P,C> reject(F reject)
        Description copied from interface: Deferred
        This should be called when a task has completed unsuccessfully, i.e., a failure may have occurred. 
         
 Deferred deferredObject = new AbstractDeferred();
 Promise promise = deferredObject.promise();
 promise.fail(new FailCallback() {
   public void onFail(Object result) {
     // Failed :(
   }
 });

 // another thread using the same deferredObject
 deferredObject.reject("BAD");
